text: Robin D'Abreo (born March 3, 1975 in Bombay, India) is a Canadian field hockey player, who earned his first international cap in 1993 against France. The midfielder D'Abrero grew up with the sport in India where both his father (Ralph D'Abreo) and older brother played the game. It was only in Canada though that D'Abreo himself started playing competitively. He began with the Toronto Field Junior Jets at age thirteen. D'Abreo is married to former Canadian Women's National Team player Dana Anderson. ==International senior competitions== * 1993 - Intercontinental Cup, Poznan (7th) * 1995 - Pan American Games, Mar del Plata (2nd) * 1996 -
